botanical_details.genus: Prunus can be deciduous or evergreen trees or shrubs with showy flowers in spring, and often good autumn foliage colour. Some have edible fruit in autumn, and a few species have ornamental bark

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a sheltered position in moist, but well-drained soil, ideally with a pH of 6 to 6.5. Best in full sun, but will tolerate some shade. Irrigate in dry periods. Fruit thinning may be required. See plum cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by chip budding or grafting. Trees grown from stones will not resemble the parent
how_to_grow.pruning: Regular pruning required according to tree form, see pruning plums or pruning established fans
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to plum aphid, caterpillars, fruit tree red spider mite, brown scale, plum moth and bullfinches
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to silver leaf, bacterial canker, blossom wilt, pocket plum and brown rot
